english: give as a present; send to

etymology.description: 送 + 给 = send/deliver + give/to → give as a present; send to (someone).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the act of sending with giving, highlighting transfer to a specific recipient. Commonly places the item before 送给 and the recipient after, or splits as 送…给….
etymology.simplification: 給 → 给: the silk radical 糹 was simplified to 纟 and strokes were reduced; 送 is unchanged.

parts.english: to deliver; to send; to present (as a gift); to see off
to give; to; for; to supply

examples.chinese: 我想把这本书送给你(我想把這本書送給你)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng bǎ zhè běn shū sòng gěi nǐ.
examples.english: I want to give this book to you.

examples.chinese: 生日时(生日時)，她送给老师一束花(她送給老師一束花)。
examples.pinyin: Shēngrì shí, tā sòng gěi lǎoshī yī shù huā.
examples.english: On her birthday, she gave the teacher a bouquet of flowers.

examples.chinese: 快递员已把包裹送给收件人了(快遞員已把包裹送給收件人了)。
examples.pinyin: Kuàidìyuán yǐ bǎ bāoguǒ sòng gěi shōujiànrén le.
examples.english: The courier has already delivered the package to the recipient.
